Title: Analysis of satisfaction factor for development recommendation tourism web system
Source title: Journal of Environmental Management and Tourism
Affiliations: Management Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sfenrianto, Management Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Girsang, A.S., Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Ruman, F., Management Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Indoensia.travel as one tourism web which is managed Indonesia government should give a satisfaction for users to provide useful information and travel referenced in Indonesia. However, many users have expressed dissatisfaction such as system has not provided sightseeing recommendations in accordance with the wishes and needs of users. Therefore, this paper aims to conduct the gap analysis based on some dimensions in Indonesia.travel. Analyzed is performed between user expectation and the existing web system to obtain the gap point. ISO 9126 which is issued by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) and International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC) is used for standard to obtain the gap point. The gap point on functionality, usability and efficiency dimension are used to measure the gap. This significant gap obtained is used to develop the recommendation system in order to enhance the satisfaction user. © 2016, ASERS Publishing House. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Analysis gap; Indoensia.travel; ISO; Recommendation; Tourism
References: Ahmad, S.F., Beg, M.R., Haleem, M., A Comparative Study of Software Quality Models (2013) International Journal of Science, Engineering and Technology Research, 2 (1), p. 172; Al, Q., Rafa, E., Quality Models in Software Engineering Literature: An Analytical and Comparative Study (2010) Journal of American Science, 6 (3), pp. 166-175; Bee Bee Chua, L.E., Applying the ISO 9126 model to the evaluation of an elearning (2004) ASCILITE, pp. 184-190; Hendijani, R.B., Push and pull factors of inbound tourists to Indonesia (2015) Journal of Environmental Management and Tourism, 6 (2), pp. 331-337; (2009) Pengaruh Kepuasan Pengguna Sistem Informasi Terhadap Kinerja Individu, 12. , Istianingsih, Utami, Wiwi, Simposium Nasional Akuntansi.
